document.docTitle: Gymnetis litigiosa Gory & Percheron 1833, new status
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

paragraph.heading:
Gymnetis litigiosa Gory & Percheron, 1833
, new status

treatmentCitationGroup.paragraph:
[
Gymnetis ] Litigiosa . Dej
.:
Dejean 1833: 169
(catalog; distribution); Burmeister 1861 ( 1943 ). Vol. I: 499 (distribution).

subSubSection.paragraph:
“Species akin to
Gymnetis rufilatris
” (translated from Spanish): Burmeister 1943: 171 (distribution).

Gymnetis inquinita Thomson, 1878: 11
(description; distribution); Schenkling 1921: 95 (reference); Bosq 1926 (natural history).

Paragymnetis chalcipes
G. & P.
subsp. litigiosa G. & P
.: Schürhoff 1937: 67 (distribution); Blackwelder 1944: 263 (distribution).

Paragymnetis litigiosa G. y P
.: Hayward 1960: 24 (natural history); Di Iorio 2004: 184 (catalog; distribution; references).

Gymnetina ( Gymnetoides ) chalcipes litigiosus (G. & P., 1833)
: Monné 1970: 61 (references).

Paragymnetis chalcipes litigiosa (Gory & Perch.)
: Viana & Williner 1981: 36 (distribution).

Gymnetis chalcipes ssp. litigiosa Gory & Percheron, 1833
: Krajčík 1998: 76 (catalog; distribution)

Gymnetis sp.
: Amela García & Hoc 1998: 21 (natural history); Di Iorio 2004: 184 (catalog; distribution; reference).

Note 1 :
Gymnetis inquinata Thomson, 1878
, described from “ Cordova ” ( Bergé 1884 ) but cited from Chaco ( Blackwelder 1944 ), was placed in the synonymy of
G. litigiosa
(bibliographic reference not found). His status needs to be revised, and one possibility is that
G. inquinata
may correspond to
G. hepatica
, also distributed in Córdoba and Chaco .

Note 2 : In some specimens, a pale orange color appears only in a band near the lateral margins of the elytra, with the dark maculation superimposed, then the band is regularly interrupted, probably the “species related to
Gymnetis rufilatris
” of Burmeister (1861 , 1943 ) from Santiago del Estero .
Note 3 : The original record from Brazil ( Schenkling 1921 , Blackwelder 1944 ) was not found.

Note 4 :
Gymnetis litigiosa
is similar but different species from
Gymnetis chalcipes
. The venter, legs, and tarsi in
G. litigiosa
are black ( Fig. 46 ) instead of the cupreous color seen in
G. chalcipes
( Figs. 44–45 ). The parameres of both species are also distinctive ( Figs. 52 versus 53). Therefore,
G. litigiosa
is here considered as a good species separate from
G. chalcipes
. The male parameres of
G. hepatica
are also distinctive ( Fig. 54 ).

Note 5 :
Gymnetis litigiosa
is also found in Paraguay in the following localities:
San Pedro
: 23° 42' 40.11" S , 56° 40' 19.03" W ( S23.68547 , W56.66285 ); 24° 23' 15.12" S , 57° 6' 50.00" W ( S24.36267 , W57.10650 );
Presidente Hayes
: 25° 4' 12.36" S , 57° 52' 10.90" W ( S25.06667 , W57.86666 );
Central
: 25° 17' 51.28" S , 57° 37' 10.60" W ( S25.29500 , W57.61816 ) ( Paraguay Biodiversidad 2012 ).
